Description: Fragment of parchment; Old Nubian text in red and black ink recto and verso. Part of a sermon on the Archangel Raphael attributed to John Chrysostom. Black ink with red diacriticals, and red also used for the name of Raphael.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), 'Scattered in a few centimetres of dust overlying the pavement of the nave of the cathedral of St Mary the Virgin'.
Curator's comments: Published: Plumley and Browne, Old Nubian Texts from Qasr Ibrim I, 40-7, pl. 9-10; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 332-3.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1999 / Coptic antiquities in the Department of Egyptian Antiquities, British Museum (p.89)
Exhibition history: 2023-2024 13 Nov-3 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum, Africa and Byzantium
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Parchment Iron gall ink Pigments Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A
